department.en: Graduate School, Division of Dental Research

paper_title.ja: ポリサルホン義歯長期使用例による樹脂表層面の変化
paper_title.en: Observation Tends to Surface of Long Term Wearing Polysulfone Denture Base

description.ja: 明海大学病院補綴科外来で装着したポリサルホン義歯使用例のリコールを行い,以前報告した樹脂表層の白化現象が,従来より使用されているポリメチルメタクリレートと比較して義歯表層面がどのように変化しているかをSEMを用いて観察した.その結果,ポリサルホン樹脂は口腔内において,粘膜面ではより滑沢な表面像を呈し,咀咽に相当する樹脂面は表層面が起毛した状態となり肉眼で白化を観察されることが判明した.また,人工歯の歯間乳頭部の樹脂については食物により削り取られることもなく平滑であった.同様の観察をポリメチルメタクリレート樹脂においても行い,併せて報告することとした.
description.en: In recent years, engineering plastics have been used as materials for denture bases, which havebeen formed by the injection or compression molding method. The results of evalution of these dentures wornintraorally have been published.In this report, we focused on the method whereby polysulfone was preformed to a shape suiting denturebase fabrication (Ube Industries Ltd.) ; polysulfone dentures, constructed by using a systematic method calledUB Denture System, were placed in the mouths of 21 patients ! and their clinical courses were followed. Thefindings of these observations are presented.

publisher.ja: 社団法人日本補綴歯科学会

publication_name.en: The journal of the Japan Prosthodontic Society

description.en: In recent years, engineering plastics have been used as materials for denture bases, which havebeen formed by the injection or compression molding method. The results of evalution of these dentures wornintraorally have been published.In this report, we focused on the method whereby polysulfone was preformed to a shape suiting denturebase fabrication (Ube Industries Ltd.) ; polysulfone dentures, constructed by using a systematic method calledUB Denture System, were placed in the mouths of 21 patients ! and their clinical courses were followed. Thefindings of these observations are presented.

paper_title.en: The Precision during Mounting Cast by Slurry Water

description.ja: I spatulated dental stone with slurry water auad mouuated the cast on tlae articulater with that plaster. In consequence I had the following results. 1. Usin g slurry water mixed sediment and water (the top clean part) at the rate of 1 : 1, if I add water powder ratio, the vertical displacement of cast and upper frame was little. 2. Using slurry water mixed sediment and water at the rate of 1 : 2, the displacement was as little as the one at the rate of 1 : 1 in the high water powder ratio. 3. Compared 1 : 1 with 1 : 2, using high water powder ratio minimized the displacement. Last time I reported, using low water powder ratio and bad liquidity plaster and moist cast, it get large setting expansion, and if not loading upper frame, it is hard to restore incisal pin to the original state of the incisal table. It is similar to use slurry water. Using slurry water with high water powder ratio, I get good precision compared with using usual plaster. Still more it is related to the shortening time of mounting cast, and to improve the efficiency of dental technical work.
description.en: I spatulated dental stone with slurry water auad mouuated the cast on tlae articulater with that plaster. In consequence I had the following results. 1. Usin g slurry water mixed sediment and water (the top clean part) at the rate of 1 : 1, if I add water powder ratio, the vertical displacement of cast and upper frame was little. 2. Using slurry water mixed sediment and water at the rate of 1 : 2, the displacement was as little as the one at the rate of 1 : 1 in the high water powder ratio. 3. Compared 1 : 1 with 1 : 2, using high water powder ratio minimized the displacement. Last time I reported, using low water powder ratio and bad liquidity plaster and moist cast, it get large setting expansion, and if not loading upper frame, it is hard to restore incisal pin to the original state of the incisal table. It is similar to use slurry water. Using slurry water with high water powder ratio, I get good precision compared with using usual plaster. Still more it is related to the shortening time of mounting cast, and to improve the efficiency of dental technical work.

paper_title.ja: 咬合器操作時の精度に関する再検討 第3報 前後的変位について
paper_title.en: Reexamination of the Precision during Articulator Handling : Part 3. Anteroposterior Displacement

description.ja: Using several brands of articulators, we examined the precision involved in the manipulation of them. We reported in the first study mainly about the vertical displacement of the upper frame as we adjusted artictulators. In tlae second study, we investigated about lateral displacement. This time, we measured the anteroposterior displacement of the upper frame as we adjusted the "Inclination of sagittal condyle path" (I. S. C. P) or the "Inclination of sagittal incisal path" (I. S. I. P). And next, we measured the anteroposterior displacement, which is caused when we loaded statically to the center of the upper frame, or also measured the rest displacement after having removed the vertical load. We got these results. The rigidity or the precision of articulators should be taken into consideration, and we should adjust the I. S. C. P to 30° and the I. S. I. P to 0° as we mount a model. However we found error due to anteroposterior displacement during these adjustments after mounting a model. So we should take these things into consideration and use articulators in the clinic.
description.en: Using several brands of articulators, we examined the precision involved in the manipulation of them. We reported in the first study mainly about the vertical displacement of the upper frame as we adjusted artictulators. In tlae second study, we investigated about lateral displacement. This time, we measured the anteroposterior displacement of the upper frame as we adjusted the "Inclination of sagittal condyle path" (I. S. C. P) or the "Inclination of sagittal incisal path" (I. S. I. P). And next, we measured the anteroposterior displacement, which is caused when we loaded statically to the center of the upper frame, or also measured the rest displacement after having removed the vertical load. We got these results. The rigidity or the precision of articulators should be taken into consideration, and we should adjust the I. S. C. P to 30° and the I. S. I. P to 0° as we mount a model. However we found error due to anteroposterior displacement during these adjustments after mounting a model. So we should take these things into consideration and use articulators in the clinic.

description.ja: Using several brands of articulators, we examined the precision involved in the manipulation of them. We reported in the first study mainly about the vertical displacement of the upper frame as we adjusted artictulators. In tlae second study, we investigated about lateral displacement. This time, we measured the anteroposterior displacement of the upper frame as we adjusted the "Inclination of sagittal condyle path" (I. S. C. P) or the "Inclination of sagittal incisal path" (I. S. I. P). And next, we measured the anteroposterior displacement, which is caused when we loaded statically to the center of the upper frame, or also measured the rest displacement after having removed the vertical load. We got these results. The rigidity or the precision of articulators should be taken into consideration, and we should adjust the I. S. C. P to 30° and the I. S. I. P to 0° as we mount a model. However we found error due to anteroposterior displacement during these adjustments after mounting a model. So we should take these things into consideration and use articulators in the clinic.
description.en: Using several brands of articulators, we examined the precision involved in the manipulation of them. We reported in the first study mainly about the vertical displacement of the upper frame as we adjusted artictulators. In tlae second study, we investigated about lateral displacement. This time, we measured the anteroposterior displacement of the upper frame as we adjusted the "Inclination of sagittal condyle path" (I. S. C. P) or the "Inclination of sagittal incisal path" (I. S. I. P). And next, we measured the anteroposterior displacement, which is caused when we loaded statically to the center of the upper frame, or also measured the rest displacement after having removed the vertical load. We got these results. The rigidity or the precision of articulators should be taken into consideration, and we should adjust the I. S. C. P to 30° and the I. S. I. P to 0° as we mount a model. However we found error due to anteroposterior displacement during these adjustments after mounting a model. So we should take these things into consideration and use articulators in the clinic.

publisher.ja: 社団法人日本補綴歯科学会

publication_name.ja: 日本補綴歯科學會雜誌

paper_title.ja: 咬合器操作時の精度に関する再検討 第2報 側方的変位について
paper_title.en: Reexamination of the Precision during Articulator Handling : Part 2. Lateral Displacement

description.ja: 今日, 補綴物作製にはその利点より間接法が主流となり, 各種の咬合器が広く臨床で使用されている. すなわち間接法によって義歯や鋳造冠を作製する場合, あるいは咬合診断等を行う場合において咬合器の利用価値は高い. このように使用頻度が高まった各種咬合器をいかに操作すれば, より高精度で使用できるかを解明する目的で本研究を企画した. 第1報では, 咬合器の調節時あるいは静的荷重時に生じる上弓の垂直的変位について主に実験を行った. 今回はこのような場合に生じる側方的変位について検討を行った. その結果, 著者らが考案した模型再装着法は調節誤差を補償するために有効と思われた.
description.en: Using several brands of articulators, we examined the precision involved in the manipulation of them. We reported in the first study mainly about the vertical displacement of the upper frame as we adjusted articulators. This time, we measured the lateral displacement of the upper frame as we adjusted the' Inclination of sagittal condyle path' (I.S.C.P.) or the' Inclination of sagittal incisal path' (I.S.I.P.). And next, we measured the one, which is caused when we loaded statically to the center of the upper frame, or also measured the rest displacement after having removed the vertical load. We got these results. The rigidity or the precision of articulators should be taken into consideration, and we should adjust the I.S.C.P. to 30°and the I.S.I.P. to 0° as we mount a model. However we found error due to lateral displacement during these adjustments after mounting a model. So we should take that into consideration and use articulators in the clinic.

publisher.ja: 社団法人日本補綴歯科学会

publication_name.ja: 日本補綴歯科学会雑誌
publication_name.en: The journal of the Japan Prosthodontic Society

paper_title.ja: 咬合器操作時の精度に関する再検討 第1報 垂直的変位について
paper_title.en: Reexamination of the Precision during Articulator Handling : Part 1 : Vertical Displacement

description.ja: 今回, 補綴物作成にはその利点より間接法が主流になり, 各種の咬合器が広く臨床で使用されている. 例えば, 間接法によって作成される鋳造冠等は咬合面形態や辺縁の適合性に有利であり, また咬合診断等においても咬合器の利用価値は高い. このように使用頻度が高まった各種咬合器を, いかに操作すればより高精度で使用できるかを解明する目的で本研究を企画した. 実際には模型装着等の操作時において, 咬合器に外力が負荷される結果変形が生じることやその調節時に不測の変位が生じることが予想される. そこで今回は, 咬合器の調節時や静的荷重時に生じる上弓下弓間の垂直的変位や残留する垂直的変位について検討を加えた.
description.en: Using several brands of articulators, we examined the precision involved in the manipulation of them. First of all, we measured the vertical dimension between the upper and lower frame as we adjusted articulator. Secondly, we measured the vertical load given to the upper frame by handling. Thirdly, we measured the vertical displacement, which is caused when we loaded statically to the center of the upper frame, or also measured the rest displacement after having removed the vertical load. We got these results. The rigidity or the precision of articulators should be taken into consideration, and we should adjust the 'Inclination of sagittal condyle path' (I,S.C.P.) to 30°and the 'Inclination of sagittal incisal path' (I.S.I.P) to 0° as we mount a model. However we found error due to vertical displacement during these adjustments after mounting a model. So we should take these things into consideration and use articulators in the clinic.

publisher.ja: 社団法人日本補綴歯科学会

publication_name.ja: 日本補綴歯科学会雑誌
